The stress of going through the world’s most public breakup is clearly taking its toll on Angelina Jolie. Close Angelina Jolie: 'Brad is a wonderful father' UP NEXT VIDEO Angelina Jolie: 'Brad is a wonderful father'. Source: GMA Angelina Jolie: 'Brad is a wonderful father' 
Currently doing press for her new film First They Killed My Father , 41-year-old Ange can’t seem to escape questions about her split from Brad Pitt. Ange filed for divorce back in September last year. Source: Getty 
During a chat with Good Morning America ’s George Stephanopoulous, Angelina was all smiles when talking about her six kids and their experiences in Cambodia during the production and promotion of the film. The actress was happy to talk about her kids. Source: GMA 
But when the TV host turned the discussion to her failed marriage, Ange became visibly emotional. Brad and Angelina have six kids together. Source: Getty 
George quoted Angelina’s statement from September last year, when she first filed for divorce. “You said [you were filing] ‘for the health’ of your family. Is your family healthier now?” The star attempts to compose herself before answering the TV host's questions. Source: GMA 
Angelina takes a moment to compose herself, and seems to be holding back tears as she figures out how best to answer the probing question. An emotional Ange says Brad is still 'a wonderful father'. Source: GMA 
“We are focusing on the health of our family, so we will be,” she says shakily. “We will be stronger. Because that’s what we’re determined to do as a family.” At one point, Ange seems to be holding back tears. Source: GMA 
Not quite done with the third degree, George focuses on Ange’s ex. “You once described Brad as ‘a wonderful father’. Do you still believe that?” 
RELATED: Did Brad cheat on Ange? 
A misty-eyed Angelina answers: “Of course, of course. We will always be a family. Always.” 
The latest interview comes after Ange revealed to the BBC that the past few months had been a “difficult time” for the family.
